Description: Section of a Nile silt pottery bowl, reconstructed from fragments, with flat base flaring sides and slightly everted rim. The interior is coated with red slip, burnished and decorated in white pigment with a delicate plant-frond motifs radiating from a circle in the centre. Solid white triangles are painted along the edge of the interior lip. The exterior is slipped with only cursory burnishing.
Curator's comments: Petrie’s White Cross line (C) ware. Published: G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 578; pl. 6.19. The frond motif was popular and Graff discussing other parallels on p. 119.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 70; pl. xxxiv.29)
